oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Zion Christian Cemetery sign
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Gardner, Leigh Ann, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Finding Community
Cemeteries
African American cemeteries
Historical markers
oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: United States -- Tennessee -- Shelby County -- Memphis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Historic marker at the Zion Christian Cemetery.

The United Sons of Zion were one of the oldest African American fraternal groups in Memphis, Tennessee. In 1873, the group purchased 15 acres to establish a cemetery for its members. Burials began in 1876, and more than 30,000 African Americans are buried in the cemetery.
